strIntroduction: Experience one of the most popular leisure activities in Korea and get a taste of authentic Korean culture Discover a unique part of the Korean culture in a beautifully decorated Korean-style bathhouse Unwind from your stressful day in a traditional oak wood sauna Gain access to all saunas and steam rooms that include various salt and minerals for your skin Treat yourself to a massage, facials and hair scrubs available when booking the Spa Set Perfect for busy schedules as the bathhouse is open 24/7 Discover a unique part of the Korean culture in a beautifully decorated Korean-style bathhouse Unwind from your stressful day in a traditional oak wood sauna Gain access to all saunas and steam rooms that include various salt and minerals for your skin Treat yourself to a massage, facials and hair scrubs available when booking the Spa Set Perfect for busy schedules as the bathhouse is open 24/7 What We Love:   What We Love: This Traditional Korean Bathhouse in Insadong is a must-do activity not only to relax, but also to learn about Korean tradition and culture. Commonly referred to as "Jjimjilbang", these large bathhouses are popular all over Korea for their hot tubs, showers, Korean traditional kiln saunas, and massage tables. Going to a sauna has been a frequent activity for locals for many centuries. The high temperatures found in the sauna are especially popular to alleviate any pressure in the body and boost blood circulation. Whether you go there to boost your health or simply to hang out with friends, time will fly by as you relax!

Trickeye, short for ‘trick of the eye' refers to an art technique where two-dimensional paintings are turned into three-dimensional images through the use of optical illusions. Marvel at the erotic images throughout the museum – and stimulate your inner fantasies and desires! Visitors are allowed to freely explore the multiple galleries with their eyes, hands, and of course, cameras. strIntroduction: Explore Jeju's Eastern side from beautiful peak views to underground lava tunnels and every bit of culture and heritage in between View modern and ancient culture at a modern illusion gallery, Korean folk village and women diver show Discover beautiful nature by trekking Seongsan Ilchulbong Bong peak and exploring Manjang Cave See Jeju with a multi-award winning tour operator specializing in tours for independent travelers Tuck into a delicious choice of Jeju Black Pork BBQ or Bimimbap for lunch Enjoy the convenience of hotel transfers included View modern and ancient culture at a modern illusion gallery, Korean folk village and women diver show View modern and ancient culture at a modern illusion gallery, Korean folk village and women diver show Discover beautiful nature by trekking Seongsan Ilchulbong Bong peak and exploring Manjang Cave Discover beautiful nature by trekking Seongsan Ilchulbong Bong peak and exploring Manjang Cave See Jeju with a multi-award winning tour operator specializing in tours for independent travelers See Jeju with a multi-award winning tour operator specializing in tours for independent travelers Tuck into a delicious choice of Jeju Black Pork BBQ or Bimimbap for lunch Tuck into a delicious choice of Jeju Black Pork BBQ or Bimimbap for lunch Enjoy the convenience of hotel transfers included Enjoy the convenience of hotel transfers included What We Love:   What We Love: This multi-award winning tour operator has specialized in excursions around Jeju since 2008 with a particular focus on independent travelers so you won't be getting any of that ‘follow the flag' tour group stuff. Start the day on a fun note by taking hilarious and mind-boggling snaps at the 3D Trick Art Museum. See a unique part of Jeju's cultural heritage at Seongeup Folk Village, nestled at the foot of Mt. Halla then watch Jeju's famed 'haenyeo' female divers in action and braving the cold as they hunt for the freshest catch. Take a trek up a volcanic peak for breathtaking views before delving inside Manjang Cave, one of the most impressive lava tunnels in the world. And for the complete Korean experience, you'll even get a traditional lunch included too!

Begin by visiting Hallim Park to roam the beautiful landscaped gardens. A short trek up Suweolbong will reward you with incredible ocean views (named after an interesting legend). After a Korean-style buffet lunch, you'll visit the world's largest botanical garden before swinging by the Althr Airfield, once a Japanese army base camp, on the way to Mt Sanbang. Here you'll make the trek up a mountain formed of volcanic lava, containing a cave 150m above the sea, ready to treat you with gorgeous ocean views once you step within. The final stop is Cheonjeyeon Waterfall, an impressive 22m cascade said to be the watery home of nymphs. Or if you'd rather a change from nature, head to the Teddy Bear museum instead!

This utterly innovative idea showcases the mind-blowing skills of live illustrators with incredible visual effects, alongside a witty blend of mime, dance and comedy. From here, you can make yourself comfortable onboard the luxury cruiser: try your hand at fishing, keep a look out for Jeju's playful dolphins or simply relax atop the spacious deck. These aren't just any paintings though, they're installed onto plain surfaces but magically appear to be 3D through the use of optical illusion. Learn about the history of Trompe-l'oeil illusion art, become part of famous artworks, and have hours of fun taking pictures at this fully interactive gallery. Trick Eye Museum also boasts the first gallery in Jeju featuring Lumi art - where the painting changes under fluorescent light. You can also get additional entry into the nearby Museum of Greek Mythology, bringing alive around 200 reproductions of famous paintings and marble sculptures found in world-renowned museums including the Louvre and the Vatican Museums!

What We Love:   What We Love: Visit the largest aquarium in all of Asia - Aqua Planet Jeju! The scale is approximately 11 times that of Aqua Planet 63 in Seoul. Visit the aquarium and see over 48,000 animals and plants of around 500 species in exhibition. There are so many ways to entertain all ages as it offers world's top ten educational, cultural, and entertainment programs. Check out multiple performances throughout the day on the 1st floor Ocean Arena. Don't miss the dynamic performance by an Eastern European synchronized swimming team or the many presentations about the ecology of marine animals. Visit the world's largest 330 square meter touch pool on the basement floor and experience and area where you can see, touch, and feel marine life. If you are bringing kids you do not want to miss the Kids Planet area for activities specifically tailored to the little ones!

Experience the amazing open stage performances of dolphins, sea lions and monkeys - trained using non-violent methods where the animals' welfare comes first See dolphins as they swim and dance throughout the water Watch as the cute sea lions work with their trainers and show you flips and tricks Discover the skills of the Japanese monkey as they ride a motorcycle and play basketball Located in the Jungmun Resort, you will be walking distance from many hotels, interesting sites and museums See dolphins as they swim and dance throughout the water Watch as the cute sea lions work with their trainers and show you flips and tricks Discover the skills of the Japanese monkey as they ride a motorcycle and play basketball Located in the Jungmun Resort, you will be walking distance from many hotels, interesting sites and museums What We Love:   What We Love: The Pacific Land Show is located in the Jungmun Resort - a multi tourism area of Jeju Island and the largest resort in Korea. Pacific Land offers three great performances upon admission including a dolphin show, sea lion show and monkey show. Non-violent methods are used to train the animals and you'll notice that if an animal doesn't want to perform a trick, the trainers will not force him to. Enjoy watching a diverse group of energetic dolphins as they jump and dance to music. The dolphin show also includes elaborate twists, kicks, and other tricks with highly qualified trainers. Watch as the sea lions jump dive from high altitudes and do hand-stands. The monkey show includes Japanese monkeys riding a motorcycle, playing basketball and other amazing tricks. Have your cameras ready - these clever animals will be sure to awe all ages!

Discover the small underwater marine life amidst the corals and enjoy snorkeling or the amazing feeling of walking on the ocean bed, no matter what season! You do not even need to know how to swim! In the sea walking experience you will be able to walk underwater without a hassle as a supply of fresh air is pumped consistently into your helmet. The snorkeling experience will be in the shallow area filled with beautiful corals for you to explore. Either way, you will have a guide that will assist you throughout your underwater experience and accompany you to put you at ease and guarantee your safety. Once submerged, be amazed at the sea creatures you will see up close and personal and take a moment to feed the local fishes. These are one of a kind experiences on Jeju Island you do not want to miss!

At Hello Kitty Island you will be able to view 18 exhibition halls themed around the world renowned Japanese character, Hello Kitty. Visitors can enjoy the exhibits which include the Kitty History Hall, Art Education Hall, Music Education Hall, Art Gallery, World Gallery Hall, Trip around the World Gallery Hall, Constellation Education Hall and more! Board a pirate ship or enjoy the star-gazing room complete with Hello Kitty constellations. Check out the Art Gallery where you will find collectibles, posters and pictures covering the walls highlighting Hello Kitty in every art form possible. Head up to the third floor to see the 6-minute Hello Kitty 3D movie. Once it finishes, the screen will open to reveal an outer courtyard. Take a moment to wander out, and snap a couple of pictures in front of the Hello Kitty lawn and enjoy the fresh air with a great view of Mt. Halla.

Enjoy mouthwatering handmade pizza or bread in Jeju Kaokao Pizza & Bread's open kitchen Choose between a 12-inch brick oven baked pizza or fresh bread box Watch as highly-trained chefs make the pizza right in front of your eyes Grab a delicious bread box and continue your tour of Jeju Island without missing a beat A healthier meal alternative with 100% natural cheese and fresh ingredients Choose between a 12-inch brick oven baked pizza or fresh bread box Watch as highly-trained chefs make the pizza right in front of your eyes Grab a delicious bread box and continue your tour of Jeju Island without missing a beat A healthier meal alternative with 100% natural cheese and fresh ingredients What We Love:   What We Love: The regional food of Jeju Island is quite different when compared to the food in mainland Korea. This is due mainly in part to the food’s spare use of seasonings in order to highlight the natural flavors of each dish’s ingredients. At Jeju Kaokao Pizza & Bread, they continue this island tradition and have translated it to fit their fresh pizza and bread. The chefs work in an open kitchen so once you have ordered you can see your pizza being made every step of the way. This feature makes Jeju Kaokao Pizza & Bread highly popular among tourists. The bread and pizza dough is made fresh daily in the morning - never frozen. If you do not have time to wait for your pizza, make sure to grab a bread box instead! This is a great option if you are on a busy schedule but would still like a fresh and delicious meal option.

The spa is located near a multi tourism area of Jeju Island, Pacific Land, which means you will be able to quickly continue your sightseeing after your 1 hour foot massage is done.

The cars are not only in wonderful condition, but you are even allowed to climb in and experience some of them too! If you are coming with kids there is a section just for them to feel the thrill of driving. The traffic experience area allows kids to have their photo taken and practice driving with a parent or guardian. If they do well, they'll even get their own driver's license! As you explore, remember to take a moment to look out and enjoy the views of Sanbangsan and Korea's southern-most island, Marado, from the museum.

Prepare yourself for panoramic views sure to take your breath away.

Neither did we!) Gawk at the incredible Nusa Dua scenery and satisfy your stomach rumblings with fruit juices and breakfast pastries, and when the dolphins appear, you'll soon forget the 5am start...

Learn to dive in the pristine waters of Bali with a choice of open water diver courses to suit every level of ability and experience Take your pick of diving courses: Open Water qualification if you have no previous experience or the advanced course for certified divers Learn the basics in the pool before taking on the open water Enjoy a personalized and safe experience with professional PADI instruction Take your pick of diving courses: Open Water qualification if you have no previous experience or the advanced course for certified divers Learn the basics in the pool before taking on the open water Enjoy a personalized and safe experience with professional PADI instruction What We Love:   What We Love: Once you take a PADI diving course, the internationally renowned qualification will allow you to dive anywhere in the world! Take the first step in Bali at a newly renovated dive resort with enormous onsite training pools, located on Lembongan island. This world class diving company has been operating in Bali for over 20 years and has a 100% saftey record, catering individuals and families alike with diving, snorkeling and private beach club facilities. The team of skilled professionals will ensure you get the best experience in the crystal clear waters of the Indian Ocean. Complete beginners can take the Open Water Diver qualification, the world's most popular course allowing you to dive up to 18 meters across the world. The Advanced Open Water Diver course is aimed at Open Water qualified divers who want to improve their skills and confidence and includes your choice of two specialty dives such as a night dive or an underwater photography dive.

Snorkel the pristine waters around a WWII wreck and a coral garden. Hundreds of beautiful fish and brightly colored coral are accessible, less than 3 meters below the surface Snorkel at Bali's premier dive sites: the USAT Liberty shipwreck and the neighboring Coral Garden Have a briefing by your guide to ensure you're happy with the equipment All abilities can snorkel, you just need to feel comfortable in the water Enjoy a well-deserved lunch after the experience Transfer from your hotel and back in air conditioned comfort Snorkel at Bali's premier dive sites: the USAT Liberty shipwreck and the neighboring Coral Garden Snorkel at Bali's premier dive sites: the USAT Liberty shipwreck and the neighboring Coral Garden Have a briefing by your guide to ensure you're happy with the equipment Have a briefing by your guide to ensure you're happy with the equipment All abilities can snorkel, you just need to feel comfortable in the water All abilities can snorkel, you just need to feel comfortable in the water Enjoy a well-deserved lunch after the experience Enjoy a well-deserved lunch after the experience Transfer from your hotel and back in air conditioned comfort Transfer from your hotel and back in air conditioned comfort What We Love:   What We Love: Snorkel at one of Bali's best dive sites and take the rare opportunity to snorkel a WWII wreck. The USAT Liberty, torpedoed by the Japanese, now rests off Bali's northern shores. Covering depths from 3 to 30 meters, while divers swim down to the ship's deeper crevices, snorkelers can enjoy the shipwreck's shallower parts. Not to mention the huge and colorful range of fish that have made the USAT Liberty their home. After lunch, float over to the Coral Garden, a wall of marine life that offer's some spectacular underwater exploration. This full day of snorkeling includes hotel transfers, lunch, all equipment and even a briefing to make sure you're comfortable in the water.

Explore fascinating marine life by snorkelling in the tropical waters of Lipah Bay, accompanied by thousands of colourful reef fish and beautiful coral Discover this untapped coastal area recently exposed in the early 2000s Snorkel amongst a rich variety of reef fish, coral and marine organisms Get amazing snorkeling at Lipah Bay with distinct features: a Japanese Shipwreck and Pondok Vienna Beach Enjoy convenient transfers from Ubud, Kuta, Sanur and Seminyak to the snorkelling site Discover this untapped coastal area recently exposed in the early 2000s Snorkel amongst a rich variety of reef fish, coral and marine organisms Get amazing snorkeling at Lipah Bay with distinct features: a Japanese Shipwreck and Pondok Vienna Beach Enjoy convenient transfers from Ubud, Kuta, Sanur and Seminyak to the snorkelling site What We Love:   What We Love: Looking for a snorkeling trip in Bali? Allow us to recommend this snorkelling adventure in Amed, lying at the eastermost tip of the island, and recently developed as one of the most famed diving sites in Bali. Jump right in and greet the colorful inhabitants of the sea. With clear and uncontaminated water, you are able to glimpse every corner of this underwater paradise. Two amazing snorkeling sites await: a Japanese shipwreck where you'll get the rare opportunity to explore a wreck without needing a dive certificate to delve into the deep; and Pondok Vienna Beach, home to a huge soft coral reef and the playground for a variety of tropical species. So, pack your goggles, snorkel and fins, and immerse yourself in Amed's underwater paradise!

Discover the wide variety of local goods being traded at the local market at Tabanan regency and the ancient 11th century Pura Luhur Batukaru temple, a majestic construction in the middle of a lush forest. A must-see when in Bali: take in the scenery of the Jatiluwih rice terraces, a UNESCO World Heritage site before heading to a natural volcanic hot spring, Angseri, said to cleanse and heal all your ailments.

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Experience local Sasak culture at traditional Lombok villages, famed specialists in pottery and weaving Visit Sukarara Village, known for weaving handicrafts, and Banyumulek pottery village Stroll along the powdery white sands of Lombok's famous southern beaches Admire the traditional architecture of Sade Traditional Village Visit Sukarara Village, known for weaving handicrafts, and Banyumulek pottery village Stroll along the powdery white sands of Lombok's famous southern beaches Admire the traditional architecture of Sade Traditional Village What We Love:   What We Love: Take a day trip on Lombok to discover the culture of the Sasak people - commencing with a traditional horse and cart ride at pottery haven, Banyumulek village. After looking at the magnificent art, head over to Sukurara Village, famous for ikat and songket textile weavings. You will also get to see many picturesque beaches throughout the day from the famous surfers' haven, Mawun Beach, to Tanjung A'an Beach known for its bay views. Also witness the impressive architecture of the Lombok natives who constructed traditional 'Bale Tani' houses and 'Lumbung' rice granaries.

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Descend by bicycle through Sribatu Valley for a snapshot of rural Balinese life assisted by a well-trained guide Tour run by Sobek – one of Bali's oldest and experienced adventure companies A 3 hour bike ride on a beginners track A day filled with insight into Balinese culture Hotel pick up provided from most areas in Bali Buffet lunch included in the tour Tour run by Sobek – one of Bali's oldest and experienced adventure companies Tour run by Sobek – one of Bali's oldest and experienced adventure companies A 3 hour bike ride on a beginners track A 3 hour bike ride on a beginners track A day filled with insight into Balinese culture A day filled with insight into Balinese culture Hotel pick up provided from most areas in Bali Hotel pick up provided from most areas in Bali Buffet lunch included in the tour Buffet lunch included in the tour What We Love:   What We Love: Making your way up to the cooler highlands spending the morning traversing through the nature rich Sribatu Valley taking in the luscious scenery and the quaint village life. The route passes through bamboo forests, temples, traditional village, rice fields and a palace – a truly all rounded insight into the rural life in this area. Along the way your highly experienced guide will look after you on the bikes but also share with you everything about Balinese culture and lifestyle. Finish the ride off with a lunch buffet before heading back into town.

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Tap into the local culture of Bali for a day with a guided cooking class and a relaxing spiritual healing session Get local knowledge on cooking ingredients with a morning tour of Gianyar Understand Balinese farming methods with a visit to a rice paddy field Whip up seven different Balinese dishes and learn how to make traditional medicine using locally sourced ingredients Experienced healer, Made, will guide you through a session of emotional healing, character readings and aura cleansing Get local knowledge on cooking ingredients with a morning tour of Gianyar Understand Balinese farming methods with a visit to a rice paddy field Whip up seven different Balinese dishes and learn how to make traditional medicine using locally sourced ingredients Experienced healer, Made, will guide you through a session of emotional healing, character readings and aura cleansing What We Love:   What We Love: The foodie part of your adventure begins at the Gianyar market where you will discover traditional Balinese cuisine through its ingredients. Delve deeper into the process of food creation with a rice paddy field visit and learn various rice farming methods. Receive a welcome drink and scrumptious sticky rice pancake snack before rolling up your sleeves for a Bali cooking class where you will create seven dishes including Balinese chicken skewers, black rice pudding and clear mushroom soup. End your day with the unique experience of a traditional spiritual healing session that promises to leave you feeling serene and calm.

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Experience the culture, arts, nature, history and local cuisine of Bali at the island's capital of culture, Ubud Visit the Bali Bird Park which is home to over 250 species of birds Explore the island's art and culture hub, Ubud, a prominent town in Bali's long history Enjoy local cuisine and market shopping during the tour Visit the Bali Bird Park which is home to over 250 species of birds Explore the island's art and culture hub, Ubud, a prominent town in Bali's long history Enjoy local cuisine and market shopping during the tour What We Love:   What We Love: Ubud is known as the cultural centre of Bali - filled with galleries and workshops, it is the birthplace of modern Balinese art. Begin by getting a taste for Bali's wildlife and history at Bali Bird Park and Pura Desa Batuan, one of Bali's oldest temples, renowned for its well-preserved ancient architecture before venturing onwards to Ubud, the artistic hub of Bali. In Ubud, enjoy a local lunch and market shopping experience before heading to Goa Gajah (Elephant Cave), a temple dating back to the 11th century.

A packed day of Bali adventures ticking off beautiful temples, secret lagoons and spectacular waterfalls (if you're brave enough to jump!) Start the day at famed Pura Ulun Danu which currently features on the Indonesian 50,000 rupiah note Bathe in the translucent waters of the Secret Garden - you have to see the beauty to believe it! Experience the exhilaration of jumping off 10 meter high Kembar waterfall Enjoy breakfast, lunch and hotel transfers included in the tour Start the day at famed Pura Ulun Danu which currently features on the Indonesian 50,000 rupiah note Bathe in the translucent waters of the Secret Garden - you have to see the beauty to believe it! Experience the exhilaration of jumping off 10 meter high Kembar waterfall Enjoy breakfast, lunch and hotel transfers included in the tour What We Love:   What We Love: Here's a unique Bali adventure for you. The tour begins with breakfast at the water temple Pura Ulun Danu which floats beautifully above Lake Bratan - a favorite spot for many a photographer. Cast your eyes around the surrounding scenic views and appreciate the harmony and tranquility the temple brings as the world awakens. Next you'll be led into the hidden wonders of the Secret Garden, nestled deep into Ambengan Village. Prepare yourself for the nerve-racking end to the trip - a 10 meter waterfall jump! Test your bravery as you leap and experience the moment of exhilarating free-fall from the beautiful natural falls.

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Take the evening to delve into Balinese culture. Watch the sun go down behind beautiful Pura Luhur Uluwatu, as a talented troupe perform traditional Balinese song and dance Visit Luhur Uluwatu Temple, spectacularly built at the edge of a sheer cliff face Watch a traditional Kecak dance performance, accompanied to the music of 50 men chanting in powerful unison Relax in air conditioned comfort, with hotel pick up and drop off included Visit Luhur Uluwatu Temple, spectacularly built at the edge of a sheer cliff face Visit Luhur Uluwatu Temple, spectacularly built at the edge of a sheer cliff face Watch a traditional Kecak dance performance, accompanied to the music of 50 men chanting in powerful unison Watch a traditional Kecak dance performance, accompanied to the music of 50 men chanting in powerful unison Relax in air conditioned comfort, with hotel pick up and drop off included Relax in air conditioned comfort, with hotel pick up and drop off included What We Love:   What We Love: Be mesmerized by the awe-inspiring sight of the setting sun against the beautiful Uluwatu Temple, with the shimmering Indian Ocean as a backdrop. Perched majestically atop a steep cliff side and home to a tribe of friendly monkeys, Uluwatu is one of a series of temples built to protect the island from evil spirits. Whilst here, settle in for a dramatic Kecak Dance Performance, a show of almost tribal choreography involving the percussive chants of 50 waistcloth-clad men, and flames for lighting as the evening draws in.

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Understand Lombok culture and landscape with stunning panoramic views of waterfalls and the Rinjani Volcano Travel to the Sengenter Sasak Village where villagers are experts in agriculture and agro-garden products Bask in the relaxing and cooling waters of the Sendanggila and Kelep waterfalls Enjoy the stunning panoramic view of Rinjani Volcano from a special vantage point View native Lombok and Indonesia wildlife at Rinjani National Park Travel to the Sengenter Sasak Village where villagers are experts in agriculture and agro-garden products Bask in the relaxing and cooling waters of the Sendanggila and Kelep waterfalls Enjoy the stunning panoramic view of Rinjani Volcano from a special vantage point View native Lombok and Indonesia wildlife at Rinjani National Park What We Love:   What We Love: Lombok is a treasure trove of natural wonders - clear waterfalls, lush green valleys and sweeping mountain. Visit the Batu Koq Village which is a short walk from two beautiful waterfalls, Sendanggila and Kelep. Relax and unwind in the cool waters before going to view Rinjani, the second highest volcano and third highest mountain in the country. Next, take a drive through The Rinjani National Park - home to black long-tail monkeys, deers and pigs before going on to Sapit Village where you will be able to enjoy the view of Sumbawa Island in the east. The tour ends with a fascinating visit to the graveyard of Rajah Selaparang, the first king of Lombok.

This 3-in-1 day trip is the perfect mix of Balinese adventure and beauty - ideal for those with limited time on the island Watch the world awakening from Kintamani looking across to the sun rising behind Mount Batur Embark on a rice field journey at Singaraja and sip natural coconuts fresh from the tree Watch the buffalos ploughing and take a short hike through the rice fields Have a refreshing swim beneath the Sekumpul Waterfall, one of Bali's most impressive and secluded Watch the world awakening from Kintamani looking across to the sun rising behind Mount Batur Embark on a rice field journey at Singaraja and sip natural coconuts fresh from the tree Watch the buffalos ploughing and take a short hike through the rice fields Have a refreshing swim beneath the Sekumpul Waterfall, one of Bali's most impressive and secluded What We Love:   What We Love: If you only have limited time in Bali, this fun-packed adventure is certain to please, letting you experience the expansive scenery, picturesque rice fields and impressive waterfalls all in one day. It's an early start to catch the unbeatable views of the sunrise at Kintamani, overlooking famous Mount Batur mountain while you enjoy breakfast. Experience first hand the importance of rice production in Bali as you chat to locals, watch buffalo ploughing the fields and gratefully accept refreshing coconuts fetched from the nearby palms just for you. To end the day of adventure, take a dip into the lagoon beneath the towering Sekumpul Waterfall and relax as any stress washes right away. It's a pretty idyllic way to spend your day in Bali, don't you think?

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Enjoy a full day of snorkeling and banana boating at a tropical paradise with a BBQ lunch, snacks and refreshments Relax the day away on a comfortable and top quality luxury yacht and at the Anchorage Beach Club Hours of fun with glass bottom boat, snorkeling gear, banana boats and other facilities provided Indulge in a scumptious breakfast and lunch, with snacks provided throughout the day Relax the day away on a comfortable and top quality luxury yacht and at the Anchorage Beach Club Hours of fun with glass bottom boat, snorkeling gear, banana boats and other facilities provided Indulge in a scumptious breakfast and lunch, with snacks provided throughout the day What We Love:   What We Love: Breeze through the tropical waters of Bali in The Anchorage, a top class watercraft equipped with facilities like a swimming pool, waterslide and kayaks. Choose how you want to spend your day – relax on the sundeck of the yacht with a book, go snorkeling in the colorful underwater world, then dine and chill at the world class beach club. With kayaks, banana boats, village tours and a glass bottom boat available, there will always be something to do throughout the day. Enjoy a delectable breakfast, lunch and snacks as you bask in the lap of luxury for the day.

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Traditional crafts, local art, cultural performances, Balinese lunch and great views – everything's set for your day of culture See Bali's local craft industries in action, everything from art to jewelry to woodwork Take a seat at a traditional Balinese Barong and Kris performance Tuck into a local lunch with views over sparklingly clear waters to Batur Volcano Be cleansed with a temple's holy waters and see royal tombs Choose the Private Tour and you can tailor the itinerary to fit in additional gallery stops if you wish Enjoy air conditioned transport with hotel pick up, accompanied by your friendly private guide See Bali's local craft industries in action, everything from art to jewelry to woodwork See Bali's local craft industries in action, everything from art to jewelry to woodwork Take a seat at a traditional Balinese Barong and Kris performance Take a seat at a traditional Balinese Barong and Kris performance Tuck into a local lunch with views over sparklingly clear waters to Batur Volcano Tuck into a local lunch with views over sparklingly clear waters to Batur Volcano Be cleansed with a temple's holy waters and see royal tombs Be cleansed with a temple's holy waters and see royal tombs Choose the Private Tour and you can tailor the itinerary to fit in additional gallery stops if you wish Choose the Private Tour and you can tailor the itinerary to fit in additional gallery stops if you wish Enjoy air conditioned transport with hotel pick up, accompanied by your friendly private guide Enjoy air conditioned transport with hotel pick up, accompanied by your friendly private guide What We Love:   What We Love: Aimed at culture vultures wanting a break from a beach bum holiday, first stop is a traditional, if slightly bizarre, Barong Dance performance. The colorful costumes, talented dancers and quirky actors will surely start your day with a smile. Browse the delicate gold and silver handcrafted jewelry at Celuk village before seeing impressive wood carpentry in action at Mas. You'll meet the artisans for a better understanding of the creative process. The journey continues to Kintamani for a local lunch facing the majestic cone of Batur Volcano and its vast crater lake. Visit Tirta Empul Temple famed for its cleansing holy springs before arriving at Gunung Kawi Royal Monument with its impressive valley views, royal tombs and hermitage caves. End the day with the most spectacular of Bali's iconic rice terrace views near Tegalalang. If you want to purchase a Balinese art piece as a memento of your day of culture, stops can be made along the way at Ubud's many galleries.

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Discover the wonders of Bali's northern regions. A 15-meter waterfall, healing hot springs and an abundance of beauty are all on the agenda on this full day tour Visit authentic villages offering a little piece of Balinese outdoor beauty: plantation terraces, a natural waterfall and therapeutic hot springs Tuck into a local Balinese beachside lunch included in the tour Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off Visit authentic villages offering a little piece of Balinese outdoor beauty: plantation terraces, a natural waterfall and therapeutic hot springs Visit authentic villages offering a little piece of Balinese outdoor beauty: plantation terraces, a natural waterfall and therapeutic hot springs Tuck into a local Balinese beachside lunch included in the tour Tuck into a local Balinese beachside lunch included in the tour Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Expanses of luscious green terraces, natural waterfalls and hot springs, do you need any more reasons to discover Bali's nature-brimming north? Begin your day with a scenic drive to Belimbing, stopping off along the way to see talented artisans at work at Pejaten ceramic center. On arrival at Belimbing, you're greeted with cool air and breathtaking views of rice terraces as well as coffee and cocoa plantations. Continue to Lovina Beach to enjoy a Balinese lunch overlooking the white sands and dedicated surfers. The journey resumes with a visit to the sacred hot springs of Banjar, set in a landscaped tropical garden within the jungle and said to heal ailments and cure disease. Visit a Buddhist monastery on the way to Munduk, an area of magnificent mountains and renowned for its spectacular natural waterfall that cascades from a cool 15 meters up. Return to the south passing through the beautiful twin lakes of Buyan and Tamblingan.

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Visit prominent art galleries and museums in Bali Discover old Balinese art at the ARMA Museum and Neka Art Museum, which display works dating back to the late 19th century Explore the leading collection of Ubud modern art in Bali at the Puri Lukisan Museum Let your knowledgable guide relate interesting information about the artwork Enjoy a vegetarian lunch at a restaurant with a spectacular view of the river and rice fields in Ubud Discover old Balinese art at the ARMA Museum and Neka Art Museum, which display works dating back to the late 19th century Explore the leading collection of Ubud modern art in Bali at the Puri Lukisan Museum Let your knowledgable guide relate interesting information about the artwork Enjoy a vegetarian lunch at a restaurant with a spectacular view of the river and rice fields in Ubud What We Love:   What We Love: Whether you are an art lover, budding cultural historian or someone who enjoys the beautiful things in life, this day of discovery of Bali's art galleries and museums will give you at good insight into Balinese culture. Start off at the ARMA Museum, a resort surrounded by luscious rice fields housing one of the island's largest private collection of arts and artefacts. Savor a vegetarian lunch at a popular restaurant with a wonderful view over the valley of Ubud. Visit three other museums before stopping off at some local art galleries to purchase Balinese artwork to take home as a memento if you so wish.

Get the perfect overview of Bali's countryside and villages (and get some exercise while you're at it!) with this two-hour cycling tour Cycle through Bali's famed rice terraces and quaint rural villages Spend some time with the cheeky residents of Sangeh Monkey Forest Eat lunch over spectacular panoramic views All levels can enjoy this easy cycling adventure, tailored to your needs Gain insider knowledge of Balinese rural life from your guide and experienced cycling instructor Feel at ease with one of Bali's safest biking operators and carefully maintained equipment Enjoy air conditioned transfers including hotel pick up and drop off Cycle through Bali's famed rice terraces and quaint rural villages Cycle through Bali's famed rice terraces and quaint rural villages Spend some time with the cheeky residents of Sangeh Monkey Forest Spend some time with the cheeky residents of Sangeh Monkey Forest Eat lunch over spectacular panoramic views Eat lunch over spectacular panoramic views All levels can enjoy this easy cycling adventure, tailored to your needs All levels can enjoy this easy cycling adventure, tailored to your needs Gain insider knowledge of Balinese rural life from your guide and experienced cycling instructor Gain insider knowledge of Balinese rural life from your guide and experienced cycling instructor Feel at ease with one of Bali's safest biking operators and carefully maintained equipment Feel at ease with one of Bali's safest biking operators and carefully maintained equipment Enjoy air conditioned transfers including hotel pick up and drop off Enjoy air conditioned transfers including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Two-wheels show you a side to Bali you never could have imagined. You'll be biking the back roads of famous Carang Sari village where you can glimpse the authentic life and culture of the friendly local people. On arrival at the village, relax with morning tea in the tranquil surroundings as you have your safety briefing before setting off on your two-hour cycling adventure! Cruise through untouched rice paddies and villages dotted with traditional houses and temples. Stop for photos at scenic spots, learn about local culture and high-five playful village children as you pass. Visit Sangeh Monkey Forest to meet and feed the cheeky inhabitants, watch them swing in the trees and even swim in the river! Lunch is served with a side of spectacular views overlooking panoramic vistas of nearby Ubud.

Bike from Bali's famous volcano and down to the Elephant Safari Park through trafficless villages with multiple pit stops for refreshments and food Cycle through Bali's scenic countryside and more remote villages Visit Park Taro Elephant Safari and enjoy lunch there too Gain insider knowledge of Balinese rural life from your local English speaking guide and experienced cycling instructor Feel safe with well-maintained equipment with the proper safety precautions and first aid trained guide on hand Enjoy air conditioned transfers including hotel pick up and drop off Cycle through Bali's scenic countryside and more remote villages Cycle through Bali's scenic countryside and more remote villages Visit Park Taro Elephant Safari and enjoy lunch there too Visit Park Taro Elephant Safari and enjoy lunch there too Gain insider knowledge of Balinese rural life from your local English speaking guide and experienced cycling instructor Gain insider knowledge of Balinese rural life from your local English speaking guide and experienced cycling instructor Feel safe with well-maintained equipment with the proper safety precautions and first aid trained guide on hand Feel safe with well-maintained equipment with the proper safety precautions and first aid trained guide on hand Enjoy air conditioned transfers including hotel pick up and drop off Enjoy air conditioned transfers including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Starting in view of Mount Batur volcano, this exhilarating bicycle tour winds down through 26km of lush valleys, through Balinese villages, past century-old temples and rich rice fields. Expert guides will explain the history of the land, culture, and people for an unforgettable experience, far beyond the typical tourist routes. Make a pit stop to sample exotic fruits then continue through the towering bamboo forest of Taro before ending with a delicious lunch at Bali's biggest attraction, the Elephant Safari Park (with free USD 19 entrance included!) This moderately easy route is ideal for nature loving families, couples and groups of friends who enjoy the authenticity of less explored Bali villages.

A one-of-a-kind trekking trip complete with private picnic and highlighted by a magnificent sunrise view Trek in the early morning (approx. 2:00am) to the summit of Mount Batur (1717 meters) and experience the awesome beauty of an active volcano Your personal guide / butler will escort you along the way, providing a safe and informative experience Enjoy a sumptuous breakfast meal privately set up for you Be escorted in a comfy air conditioned car Trek in the early morning (approx. 2:00am) to the summit of Mount Batur (1717 meters) and experience the awesome beauty of an active volcano Trek in the early morning (approx. 2:00am) to the summit of Mount Batur (1717 meters) and experience the awesome beauty of an active volcano Your personal guide / butler will escort you along the way, providing a safe and informative experience Your personal guide / butler will escort you along the way, providing a safe and informative experience Enjoy a sumptuous breakfast meal privately set up for you Enjoy a sumptuous breakfast meal privately set up for you Be escorted in a comfy air conditioned car Be escorted in a comfy air conditioned car What We Love:   What We Love: For all sunrise lovers – this experience is perfect. You will be escorted by private vehicle to the trekking start point. After a safety briefing, hike up Mount Batur's volcanic cone for 2 hours with your friendly local guide. As you arrive at the top, your personal butler will serve you a light breakfast of tea, coffee and pastries. Enjoy the meal while relishing the moment when the sun moves up over the horizon, casting a shimmering glow over the vast crater lake. After breakfast, you will be escorted back to the start point. Along the way, notice the paths of destruction created by the lava flow of volcanic eruptions.

strIntroduction: Discover authentic village life at one of Bali's most secluded villages and experience some unique and chilling funeral traditions Journey across the beautiful Lake Batur to gain an insight into the funeral rituals of Trunyan Village Take in fabulous views of Bali's famed rice terraces and browse for artsy souvenirs at Ubud's traditional market Enjoy a traditional Balinese lunch included in the tour Relax in air conditioned comfort, with pick up and drop off included, and an informative English speaking guide Journey across the beautiful Lake Batur to gain an insight into the funeral rituals of Trunyan Village Journey across the beautiful Lake Batur to gain an insight into the funeral rituals of Trunyan Village Take in fabulous views of Bali's famed rice terraces and browse for artsy souvenirs at Ubud's traditional market Take in fabulous views of Bali's famed rice terraces and browse for artsy souvenirs at Ubud's traditional market Enjoy a traditional Balinese lunch included in the tour Enjoy a traditional Balinese lunch included in the tour Relax in air conditioned comfort, with pick up and drop off included, and an informative English speaking guide Relax in air conditioned comfort, with pick up and drop off included, and an informative English speaking guide What We Love:   What We Love: Sick of the same old tourist sights? Well, prepare for something completely different. Explore Bali's darkest corners as you discover authentic village life, culture and tradition on this day tour of Bali's spookier side. It starts with a scenic journey to Mount Batur where a boat is waiting to take you across the lake to mysterious Trunyan village. This isolated village, only accessible by boat, has some sinister traditions. Inhabited by Bali Aga, descendants of the original Balinese, the funereal custom is to leave the dead to decompose within rudimentary bamboo cages, creating a macabre scene of skulls and bones, whilst the stench is absorbed by the fragrances of a nearby Taru Menyan tree. After this chilling but fascinating encounter, sail back to your lunch stop of traditional Balinese fare. There's time to see the panoramic views of the luscious expanses of Bali's famed rice terraces before a cultural stop off at majestic Ubud Palace and a browse of the market for arty souvenirs.

Layer upon layer of terraces curve with the terrain and the sky reflects in silvery stripes on the watery troughs. Spend a day speeding through Bali's rice gardens, one of the island's best-loved areas on account of its authenticity and beauty, and listen intently as your local guide relates tales of rural life. The heritage area of Jatiluwih is a less commercialized, less crowded region, boasting some of the world's most beautiful rice fields with views of Mount Batukaru in the distance. Alight from your bike to walk between the terraces, little huts, tumbling waterfalls and quaint temples before sitting down to a sumptuous lunch overlooking the stunning scenery.

Journey through banyan trees and banana plantations to Tanjuk Village for a unique insight into Balinese life (whilst supporting sustainable tourism). First visit a local elementary school to observe the daily lives of the local children - even get the chance to teach these eager pupils. Then it's time to meet the farmers, grab your tools and head out to the rice fields. Armed with a farmer's hat and a stick you will learn first-hand how to plough, plant, transplant and harvest rice. After your lesson, a farmer demonstrates his skill in climbing a coconut tree – you can give it a go too! Then refresh with a tasty young coconut. Once you've built up an appetite, settle down for the typical fare of a well-deserved lunch. On the return home, there's one more stop, the beautiful grounds of the Taman Ayun Royal Temple.

Visit Kusamba, a local fishing village, to see the people mining salt the traditional way. Next stop is Goa Lawah temple, a bat cave that dates back to the 11th century. Continue the tour at Tenganan village, one of Bali's most ancient villages that existed before the arrival of Hinduism. The village is famous for its unique textile with intricate motifs. Here you'll stop for lunch at a local restaurant before continuing to Karangasem Royal Palace, built by the first King of Karangasem. Nearby Taman Ujung Sukasada was used as a guesthouse of noble families and foreign official guests of the Karangasem Kingdom. The final stop is the old royal bathing palace of Tirtagangga ('water of the Ganges') featuring majestic fountains and pools, and boasting stunning rice paddy views – the perfect end to your East Bali experience.

On the Historical Malacca Tour, you will get to visit St. Peter's Church, A'Formosa Portuguese Fortress, Malacca Museum, Chen Hoon Teng Temple and more. Explore a different side of the bustling metropolis of Kuala Lumpur with a visit to Putrajaya and Agriculture Heritage Park Enjoy an informative and relaxing half day trip and discover Kuala Lumpur's calmer side in Putrajaya, 25km south of the capital Embark on a guided tour of the Agriculture Heritage Park to learn more about local farming and produce Discover more about Malaysia's signature fruits: mango, cocoa, durian, jackfruit and more Discover unique local architecture at Putra Jaya Government Centre and Putra Mosque Enjoy an informative and relaxing half day trip and discover Kuala Lumpur's calmer side in Putrajaya, 25km south of the capital Embark on a guided tour of the Agriculture Heritage Park to learn more about local farming and produce Discover more about Malaysia's signature fruits: mango, cocoa, durian, jackfruit and more Discover unique local architecture at Putra Jaya Government Centre and Putra Mosque What We Love:   What We Love: Discover Malaysia's natural treasures on the Putrajaya and Agriculture Heritage Park Tour. Located in Precinct 16, Putrajaya, the Agricultural Heritage Park offers an insight into the historical and commercial background of Malaysia's farming and artisan crafts. Here, you can sample fresh seasonal fruits and watch demonstrations of rubber tapping, latex collection, crop maintenance, fruits preservation and others. Continue the tour with a visit to Putra Jaya Government Centre and don't miss out on exploring the iconic Putra Mosque in detail. Incorporating a mix of architectural elements from Turkestan, Kazakhstan and Morocco, it's a true sight to admire.
